task.title: Upgrade the Management Console
task.shortdesc: This topic describes how to upgrade the Management Console.

ul.li: If you are upgrading the Management Console to RHEL / CentOS 7, it is important to back up the configuration you have on RHEL / CentOS 6 so you can restore it after you re-install it on RHEL /CentOS 7.
If you are upgrading when deploying the Management Console behind a load balancer (ELB), see .
The following instructions assume you have already successfully configured the Eucalyptus Management Console for Nginx in a previous version of Eucalyptus.

p.note: During the upgrade process from 4.2 to 4.3, you will upgrade the Management Console from 4.2 to 4.3 on RHEL / CentOS 6 following the normal process. After that, you will need to do a fresh install of RHEL / CentOS 7 on the same host machine, wiping out RHEL / CentOS 6 and eucaconsole 4.3. Then you re-install eucaconsole 4.3.
